Package ch.idsia.crema.factor.credal.vertex

Class VertexFactor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.idsia.crema.factor.credal.vertex.VertexFactor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CredalFactor, SeparatelySpecified<VertexFactor>, Factor<VertexFactor>, GenericFactor, Operable<VertexFactor>
    public class VertexFactor
extends Object
implements CredalFactor, SeparatelySpecified<VertexFactor>, Factor<VertexFactor>
    A Separately specified Vertex based credal factor. TODO: Data is currenlty not logged!
    Author:
    david

      • getSeparatingDomain

        public Strides getSeparatingDomain()
        Description copied from interface: SeparatelySpecified
        The domain of the separated part. This is usually the conditioning of the Factor. This side must not overlap with the data domain returned by SeparatelySpecified.getDataDomain().
        Specified by:

      • deterministic

        public static VertexFactor deterministic​(Strides left,
                                         Strides right,
                                         int... assignments)
        Static method that builds a deterministic factor (values can only be ones or zeros). Thus, children variables are determined by the values of the parents
        Parameters:
        left - Strides - children variables.
        right - Strides - parent variables
        assignments - assignments of each combination of the parent
        Returns:

      • deterministic

        public static VertexFactor deterministic​(Strides left,
                                         int assignment)
        Static method that builds a deterministic factor (values can only be ones or zeros) without parent variables.
        Parameters:
        left - Strides - children variables.
        assignment - int - single value to assign
        Returns:
